result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley M Olsen, #529368 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to Probation while on Probation.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.
Cannot vote until civil rights are restored. Cannot hold elected office. Other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a U.S. Citizen may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
Must provide a DNA sample, no surcharge. Must complete a mental health assessment and comply with recommendations. Must complete GED.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Bradley M Olsen not in court.  Attorney Kathleen Mary Gionis in court for Defendant Bradley M Olsen.  Prosecuting Atty Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for State of Wisconsin.  BJM-clerk  9:03 am  Atty Dorrance - hearing is in re of motion to lift detainer.  Atty Gionis - Def was in a significant accident & is currently in a wheelchair.  Def is incarcerated in MN.  Def has been accepted at New Beginnings in Waverly, MN.  State - tmt should be in Polk Cty.  CT - grants request.  CT MODIFIES BOND ON ITS FACE: Defendant must reside at New Beginnings treatment program in Waverly, MN & is on house arrest while there.  Must be in full compliance w/program.  If Def leaves New Beginnings for any reason, must immediately turn himself in to the Polk County Jail within 4 hours.  All other conditions of bond continue to be in full force & effect.  Def may not be given any passes to leave New Beginnings for any reason.  CT - Any detainer is lifted.  CT - Warrant quashed. 9:16 am adj.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 11:30 am.  Atty Gionis to obtain Def's signature on revised Bond & file w/COCC.
